description:
- Optimize the metrics broadcast logic to emit updates only when there are active listeners or when a client explicitly requests metrics, and throttle periodic broadcasts to a maximum of 1 Hz (1000ms) to reduce unnecessary CPU and network load.
- Centralize interval management to ensure proper cleanup on all disconnect and error paths, preventing memory leaks and stray timers.
- Add graceful handling of SIGINT (Ctrl+C) and SIGTERM signals to close the Socket.IO server and HTTP server cleanly, ensuring all resources are released.
- Introduce basic rate limiting for incoming control messages (startModel/stopModel) to prevent abuse and protect backend resources.
- Ensure all console.log statements are guarded with development-only checks to avoid performance overhead in production.

title: [backend] Optimize src/lib/server.ts – Performance, Security, and Maintainability
description:
## Optimization Plan for src/lib/server.ts

### Priority 1: Critical Security and Performance Fixes
- **CORS Whitelist**: Replace wildcard CORS origin '*' with a configurable whitelist for allowed origins
- **ModelId Validation**: Add strict validation for modelId parameters in startModel/stopModel handlers to prevent injection attacks
- **Dead Code Removal**: Remove unused imports and redundant code paths
- **Guarded Console Output**: Implement conditional logging based on environment (disable in production)
- **ParseInt Radix**: Fix parseInt calls to include radix parameter (10 for decimal)
- **Remove Unused Import**: Remove any unused imports identified

### Priority 2: Performance Improvements
- **Metrics Broadcast Throttling**: Implement throttling for metrics broadcasts to prevent overwhelming clients during high-frequency updates
- **Centralize Interval Cleanup**: Ensure all intervals are properly cleaned up on disconnect and server shutdown
- **Add Missing Signal Handlers**: Add handlers for SIGINT and other signals for graceful shutdown
- **Improve Error Handling**: Add try-catch blocks around critical operations and proper error responses

### Priority 3: Refactor for Maintainability
- **Split into Modules**: Break down the large file into smaller, focused modules (e.g., websocket handlers, metrics management)
- **Introduce Typed Event Contracts**: Define TypeScript interfaces for all WebSocket events and data structures
- **Add Rate Limiting**: Implement rate limiting for WebSocket connections and message handling
- **Externalize GPU Metrics Config**: Move hardcoded GPU metrics configuration to external config files

### Priority 4: Code Quality Improvements
- **Code Formatting**: Apply consistent code formatting and linting fixes
- **Documentation Updates**: Update JSDoc comments and add inline documentation for complex logic

title: [backend] Priority 2 – Performance Improvements for src/lib/server.ts
description:
Implement the following performance enhancements in src/lib/server.ts:
- Optimize the metrics broadcast logic to emit updates only when there are active listeners or when a client explicitly requests metrics, and throttle periodic broadcasts to a maximum of 1 Hz (1000ms) to reduce unnecessary CPU and network load.
- Centralize interval management to ensure proper cleanup on all disconnect and error paths, preventing memory leaks and stray timers.
- Add graceful handling of SIGINT (Ctrl+C) and SIGTERM signals to close the Socket.IO server and HTTP server cleanly, ensuring all resources are released.
- Introduce basic rate limiting for incoming control messages (startModel/stopModel) to prevent abuse and protect backend resources.
- Ensure all console.log statements are guarded with development-only checks to avoid performance overhead in production.
